The Lebanese army patrolled the country's southern border with Israel for the first time in nearly 40 years today.
A lone Jeep flying the Lebanese flag and carrying just two soldiers drove through the town of Kafar Kilah(ph), just a few yards from the border.
Villagers throughout southern Lebanon have been throwing rice and waving banners to welcome the army.
Many of those villages were severely damaged during the fighting between Israel and Hezbollah.
